Subject: Outstation provides ATOT
Source Text: Origin and priority The outstation provides ATOT to the Network Operations and Aircraft Operator.

Subject: Network Operations receives ATOT
Source Text: Origin and priority The outstation provides ATOT to the Network Operations and Aircraft Operator.

Subject: Aircraft Operator receives ATOT
Source Text: Origin and priority The outstation provides ATOT to the Network Operations and Aircraft Operator.

Subject: ATOT received from Network Operations FUM (long flight)
Source Text: Effect If the departure airport is more than 3hrs flying time from the destination airport the ATOT is received from either the Network Operations FUM or via the Aircraft Operator / Ground Handler.

Subject: ATOT received via AO/GH (long flight)
Source Text: Effect If the departure airport is more than 3hrs flying time from the destination airport the ATOT is received from either the Network Operations FUM or via the Aircraft Operator / Ground Handler.

Subject: ELDT calculated (long flight)
Source Text: Using the ATOT an ELDT can be calculated by using the Estimated Elapsed Time on the FPL.

Subject: Network Operations monitors flight progress (short flight)
Source Text: If the flight is within 3hrs flying time of the destination airport the Network Operations monitors progress of the flight using the ETFMS and send a Flight Update Message (FUM) that provides updates of the flight’s progress.

Subject: Network Operations sends FUM (short flight)
Source Text: If the flight is within 3hrs flying time of the destination airport the Network Operations monitors progress of the flight using the ETFMS and send a Flight Update Message (FUM) that provides updates of the flight’s progress.

Subject: Outstation provides ATOT
Source Text: Origin and priority The outstation provides ATOT to the Network Operations and Aircraft Operator.

Source Text: Origin and priority The outstation provides ATOT to the Network Operations and Aircraft Operator.

Subject: Network Operations receives ATOT

Source Text: Effect If the departure airport is more than 3hrs flying time from the destination airport the ATOT is received from either the Network Operations FUM or via the Aircraft Operator / Ground Handler.

Subject: Take off from outstation
Source Text: This process is triggered by n the take off from outstation.

Subject: Operational status changes to AIRBORNE
Source Text: Operational Status AIRBORNE (changes to)

Subject: Calculate TTOT based on EIBT+MTTT+EXOT
Source Text: Calculation basis for the TTOT shall take into account EIBT+MTTT+EXOT.

Subject: Adjust TTOT if EOBT is later than EIBT+MTTT
Source Text: In case EOBT is later than EIBT+MTTT, TTOT equals EOBT+EXOT.

Subject: Overrule TTOT estimate with TOBT+EXOT if TOBT is available
Source Text: In the case where TOBT is available this prediction will overrule the EIBT+MTTT estimate, hence TTOT equals TOBT+EXOT.

Subject: ELDT, EIBT, TOBT, and TTOT updated in ACISP
Source Text: Action on CDM Operation (ACISP) ELDT, EIBT, TOBT and TTOT updated

Subject: Check consistency of estimated landing time with flight plan
Source Text: Procedures To check whether the AO/GH estimated landing time after take off from outstation are consistent with the outbound ATC Flight Plan

Subject: Respect TTOT tolerance
Source Text: A TTOT tolerance of 5 minutes is respected before Network Operations is informed of the updated TTOT.

Subject: Inform Network Operations about updated take off time estimates
Source Text: and when needed inform the Network Operations about the updated take off time estimates using a T-DPI-t Message.
